intro: Euryops tagetoides, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with narrow, silvery-green leaves. Its bright yellow to orange flower heads bloom in spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Euryops tagetoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to warm, sunny climates.
